Field Detail

m_modalReturn

protected int m_modalReturn;
the return value for doModal. it is set however you want. MsgBoxes set it to the value of the button pressed (OK or Cancel)

Constructor Detail

DialogBox

protected DialogBox();

DialogBox

public DialogBox( const char* background );
Parameters:
background - asset name of background. Must be a skin.

~DialogBox

public virtual ~DialogBox();

Method Detail

actionPerformed

public virtual void actionPerformed( ActionEvent* event );
from ActionListener.

addListener

public void addListener( DialogListener* listener );

doModal

public virtual int doModal( Delegate* loop = 0 );
cause this dialog to be shown. Also this dialog is the only one that can accept input. If loop is non-NULL, then that delegate will be called once per game tick while modal.

getBackground

protected Skin* getBackground();

getControl

public UIThing* getControl( int id );
get the control on this dialog with the id=id

getName

public virtual string getName();

modalLoop

protected virtual bool modalLoop();
called during modalness once per game tick. overrridden version would return false to end the modal dialog

onCancel

public virtual void onCancel( DialogEvent* event );
from DialogListener used in modal processing

called when the cancel button is pressed

from DialogListener used in modal processing

paint

public virtual void paint( Display* surface );

removeListener

public void removeListener( DialogListener* listener );

setBackground

protected void setBackground( string background );
Parameters:
background - name of the background asset. Asset must be a Skin

setButtonHandler

public void setButtonHandler( int buttonID, ActionListener* listener );
set the onButtonNClick delegate for the button whose id is passed

setCancel

public void setCancel( Button* cancel );
set the cancel button. The cancel button responds to the ESC key. when the cancel button is pressed, the onCancel() method is called

setDefault

public void setDefault( Button* def );
set the default button. The Default button responds to the enter key. when the default button is pressed, the onOk() method is called

setPosition

public virtual void setPosition( Rect& pos );

setText

public virtual void setText( const char* s );

setUseKeys

public void setUseKeys( bool useKeys );

public virtual void show();
